skills.name: Given the name of a rectangle, draw or identify a corresponding diagram
Identify a rectangle from a description of the properties
Given the name of a parallelogram, draw or identify a corresponding diagram
Given the name of a rhombus, draw or identify a corresponding diagram
Given the name of a trapezium, draw or identify a corresponding diagram

explanations.A: This is a parallelogram, a shape with two pairs of parallel sides shown by the arrow notation. A rectangle is a four-sided shape with four right-angles and opposite sides equal in length. Do any of the shapes shown have these properties?
explanations.B: This is a rectangle as it has four sides, four right-angles and the opposite sides are equal in length.
explanations.C: This is a rhombus. A rectangle is a four-sided shape with four right-angles and opposite sides equal in length. Do any of the shapes shown have these properties?
explanations.D: One of the shapes shown is a rectangle... A rectangle is a four-sided shape with four right-angles and opposite sides equal in length. Which shape has these properties?

explanations.A: This is a rectangle as it has four sides, four right-angles and the opposite sides are equal in length.
explanations.B: This is a rhombus. A rectangle is a four-sided shape with four right-angles and opposite sides equal in length. Do any of the shapes shown have these properties?
explanations.C: This is a parallelogram, a shape with two pairs of parallel sides shown by the arrow notation. A rectangle is a four-sided shape with four right-angles and opposite sides equal in length. Do any of the shapes shown have these properties?
explanations.D: One of the shapes shown is a rectangle... A rectangle is a four-sided shape with four right-angles and opposite sides equal in length. Which shape has these properties?

explanations.A: This is a parallelogram, a shape with two pairs of parallel sides shown by the arrow notation. A rhombus is a four-sided shape all of whose sides are equal in length.
explanations.B: This is a rectangle as it has four sides, four right-angles and the opposite sides are equal in length. A rhombus is a four-sided shape all of whose sides are equal.
explanations.C: This is a rhombus as it is a four-sided shape with four sides equal in length. There are two, matching marks on each side to show they are all equal.
explanations.D: One of the shapes shown is a rhombus... A rhombus is a shape with four sides of equal length. Which shape has this property labelled?

explanations.A: This is a rhombus as it is a four-sided shape with four sides equal in length. There are two, matching marks on each side to show they are all equal.
explanations.B: This is a kite as it has four sides, two sets of adjacent equal sides and one pair of opposite angles. A rhombus is a four-sided shape all of whose sides are equal.
explanations.C: This is a rectangle as it has four sides, four right-angles and the opposite sides are equal in length. A rhombus is a four-sided shape all of whose sides are equal.
explanations.D: This is a trapezium as it has one pair of parallel sides. A rhombus is a four-sided shape all of whose sides are equal.

explanations.A: This a quadrilateral with opposite lengths that are equal and parallel, called a parallelogram.
explanations.B: A trapezium is a quadrilateral with only 1 pair of parallel sides, as marked by the arrows.
explanations.C: This is a quadrilateral with 4 sides of the same length, called a rhombus.
explanations.D: This is a kite, a quadrilateral that has 2 pairs of equal sides, but are not opposite or parallel.

explanations.A: A trapezium is a quadrilateral with only 1 pair of parallel sides, as marked by the arrows.
explanations.B: This is a quadrilateral where adjacent sides are equal, and one angle is a reflex, larger than 180 degrees and less than 360 degrees. It is called an arrowhead (or delta)
explanations.C: This is a quadrilateral with 4 sides of the same length, called a rhombus.
explanations.D: This a quadrilateral with opposite lengths that are equal and parallel, called a parallelogram.

explanations.A: A parallelogram is a quadrilateral with opposite lengths that are equal and parallel.
explanations.B: This is a trapezium, a quadrilateral that has only 1 pair of parallel sides.
explanations.C: This is a kite, a quadrilateral that has 2 pairs of equal sides, but are not opposite or parallel.
explanations.D: This is a regular hexagon, a 6-sided shape which are of equal length. Opposite lengths are parallel in a regular hexagon, which are represented by the arrows.

explanations.A: This is an isosceles triangle. It has 2 equal lengths and 2 equal angles. The 2 equal lengths are marked on the triangle.
explanations.B: This is a kite, a quadrilateral that has 2 pairs of equal sides, but are not opposite or parallel.
explanations.C: A parallelogram is a quadrilateral with opposite lengths that are equal and parallel.
explanations.D: This is a trapezium, a quadrilateral that has only 1 pair of parallel sides.

explanations.A: A rectangle is a quadrilateral with opposite lengths that are equal and parallel. All 4 angles are equal - 90 degrees each
explanations.B: A kite has 2 pairs of equal sides, but they are not opposite or parallel. Angles in a kite add up to 360 degrees, but they are not 90 degrees each.
explanations.C: A parallelogram is a quadrilateral with opposite lengths that are equal and parallel. However, the angles aren't all 90 degrees each
explanations.D: A rhombus is a quadrilateral. Opposite lengths are parallel and equal. However the angles are not 90 degrees each

explanations.A: A trapezium has only 1 pair of parallel sides.
explanations.B: A rhombus is a quadrilateral. Opposite lengths are parallel and equal. However the angles are not 90 degrees each
explanations.C: A rectangle is a quadrilateral with opposite lengths that are equal and parallel. All 4 angles are equal - 90 degrees each
explanations.D: A kite has 2 pairs of equal sides, but they are not opposite or parallel. Angles in a kite add up to 360 degrees, but they are not 90 degrees each.
